faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Using Our To Let Service in Ghel Ambala
faqSection.description: Get clear answers regarding the rental process tenancy agreements property management fees and legal requirements for letting property in Ghel.

faqs.question: What documentation is required to list my property with your Ghel To Let Service
faqs.answer: To list your property in Ghel you typically need clear proof of ownership such as Sale Deed or allotment letter up-to-date utility bills electricity and water connection details and a copy of your PAN and Aadhaar Card. If the property is currently tenanted we require the existing lease agreement and handover documentation. We also need authorisation to act as your letting agent to commence marketing and viewings.

faqs.question: How long does it usually take to find a reliable tenant using your service in Ghel
faqs.answer: The duration to secure a tenant in Ghel depends on several factors including the property type rental price and current market demand. On average well-priced residential properties in Ghel find a qualified tenant within 3 to 6 weeks. Commercial properties may take longer due to specialised requirements. We provide a market assessment upfront to set realistic expectations and proactively adjust marketing if necessary.

faqs.question: What is included in the comprehensive property management fee for landlords in Ghel
faqs.answer: Our comprehensive fee covers all aspects of letting and management including professional marketing photography tenant background checks lease agreement drafting rent collection maintenance coordination routine inspections and access to our 24/7 support line. The fee is a percentage of the monthly rent and varies based on the level of service required full management versus simple letting. Detailed fee structures are provided during the initial consultation.

faqs.question: How do you handle security deposits and rental agreement renewals in Ghel Ambala
faqs.answer: Security deposits are collected from the tenant and held securely in a separate account or managed as per the landlord's directive and local regulations usually equivalent to two months rent. We handle the deposit return process at the end of the tenancy ensuring deductions for verified damages are justified. For renewals we initiate negotiation 60 days before the expiry updating the lease with current market rates.

faqs.question: What is the process for conducting property inspections during the tenancy period in Ghel
faqs.answer: We conduct detailed property inspections typically every six months to ensure the tenant is maintaining the property to the required standard. These inspections are scheduled with adequate notice to the tenant as per the lease terms. A comprehensive inspection report with photographic evidence is provided to the landlord immediately following the visit highlighting any maintenance needs or areas of concern.

faqs.question: Can your To Let Service help with unfurnished properties requiring furnishing prior to letting
faqs.answer: Yes we offer value-added services including coordination with interior designers and local vendors in Ghel to furnish or semi-furnish your property to meet tenant demand. Furnished properties often command higher rents and attract premium tenants. We manage the entire fit-out process ensuring the furniture and fixtures meet local quality and durability standards.

faqs.question: What measures do you take to prevent property damage by tenants
faqs.answer: Damage prevention starts with rigorous tenant selection and clear lease clauses outlining responsibilities. We secure a significant security deposit and conduct thorough move-in and move-out condition reports. In the event of malicious damage beyond normal wear and tear we utilise the security deposit and pursue further legal action if necessary to recover costs above the deposit value.

faqs.question: Are your lease agreements fully compliant with the latest RERA guidelines in Haryana
faqs.answer: Yes absolutely. All lease agreements drafted and executed by our To Let Service strictly adhere to the regulatory framework mandated by the Real Estate Regulatory Authority RERA in Haryana and relevant local laws. This ensures legal defensibility and protects all parties involved in the rental transaction in Ghel.

faqs.question: If I live outside Ghel or Ambala can you manage my property remotely
faqs.answer: Our service is perfectly designed for non-resident landlords. We provide complete remote management solutions including online portals for viewing financial statements digital communication channels and remote access to inspection reports. You receive transparent updates and payments without needing to be physically present in Ghel.

faqs.question: How do you determine the optimal rental price for my property in the Ghel market
faqs.answer: We use a combination of comparative market analysis CMA looking at similar recently rented properties in the immediate Ghel area and expert local knowledge of demand drivers. We assess the property's unique features location amenities and condition to set a price that maximises your income potential while ensuring the property rents quickly.
